user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_add_to_fd_set_:
```c
int
MHD_add_to_fd_set_ (MHD_socket fd,
                    fd_set *set,
                    MHD_socket *max_fd,
                    int fd_setsize)
{
  if ( (NULL == set) ||
       (MHD_INVALID_SOCKET == fd) )
    return 0;

#ifndef HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE
  (void) fd_setsize;  /* Mute compiler warning */
  fd_setsize = (int) FD_SETSIZE; /* Help compiler to optimise */
#endif /* ! HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE */

  if (! MHD_SCKT_FD_FITS_FDSET_SETSIZE_ (fd,
                                         set,
                                         fd_setsize))
    return 0;
  MHD_SCKT_ADD_FD_TO_FDSET_SETSIZE_ (fd,
                                     set,
                                     fd_setsize);
  if ( (NULL != max_fd) &&
       ( (fd > *max_fd) ||
         (MHD_INVALID_SOCKET == *max_fd) ) )
    *max_fd = fd;
  return ! 0;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No explicit compiler language extensions are used in the provided code fragment. The source contains only standard C constructs: function definition and parameters, standard preprocessor conditional (#ifndef/#endif), casts ((int) FD_SETSIZE), use of fd_set and FD_SETSIZE (standard/POSIX macros), simple macro calls (MHD_SCKT_FD_FITS_FDSET_SETSIZE_, MHD_SCKT_ADD_FD_TO_FDSET_SETSIZE_), and ordinary operators (including the unusual but standard expression `! 0`).

There are no visible occurrences of recognized compiler-specific extensions that must be reported for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2, such as: __attribute__, __asm / asm, __builtin_... tokens, typeof, statement-expression ({ ... }), nested functions, computed gotos or label-as-value extensions, __extension__, or other vendor-specific keywords.

Note: the MHD_... macros and the types/constants (MHD_socket, MHD_INVALID_SOCKET, MHD_SCKT_...) are user-defined; if their definitions (not provided here) expand to compiler-specific extensions, those definitions should be inspected. However, based solely on the presented code fragment, there are no explicit language extensions to report.
